bug.author: haphaeu
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
An ImportError is raised when trying to import matplotlib. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Create a conda environemt with python 3.7 and pip conda create streamlit python=3.7 pip
Install streamlit and matplotlib pip install streamlit pip install matplotlib
Create a simple streamlit app:
<denchmark-code>import streamlit as st import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
'Hi'
</denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
Browser should show "Hi" <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
Browser show: <denchmark-code>ImportError: DLL load failed: The specified module could not be found. Traceback: File "c:\users\user\conda_envs\streamlit\lib\site-packages\streamlit\script_runner.py", line 324, in _run_script exec(code, module.__dict__) File "C:\Users\user\Git\devops\repeated_lowering_plots2\test_plt.py", line 9, in <module> import matplotlib.pyplot as plt File "c:\users\user\conda_envs\streamlit\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\__init__.py", line 174, in <module> _check_versions() File "c:\users\user\conda_envs\streamlit\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\__init__.py", line 159, in _check_versions from . import ft2font </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: Streamlit, version 0.65.3.dev20200818 Matplotlib version: 3.3.1 Python version: 3.7.7 Conda version: 4.7.10 OS version: Windows 10 Browser version: Chrome 84

comments.comment: Problem solved. Should not have installed matplotlib via pip, but rather via conda. conda install matplotlib solved it.
